result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $3,493.00 payable to Larry A., $3,093 to Diane O. and Milwaukee County Burial Assistance for $500.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept. Payable first during extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees. Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: - No Contact with the victim's family without prior court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment s. 973.195 received and reviewed by court.

THE COURT ORDERS the petition for sentence adjustment is: denied because it is not in the public interest.  Order signed and filed by the court.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing MARCH 31, 2016 received and filed. (49 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to REQUIRED BY STATUTE

Defendant Robert D Tatum in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Lisa Maggiore (Victim Witness Specialist) on behalf of Diane O., Winique R., and Larry A., on behalf of the victim.

AMENDED COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* No contact with the victim's family without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Court order 100 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.
* Restitution payable to Larry A. for $3,493, Diane O. for $3,093 and Milwaukee County Burial Assistance for $500.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during extended supervision and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;

Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored. The Court also advised the defendant that because he was convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29 he may not possess a firearm within 5 years of completing sentence or he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.
The State filed a 2nd amended information amending the charge to: Homicide by Negligent Handling of a Dangerous Weapon pursuant to Wis Stat 940.08(1) and 939.50(3)(g), a class "G" Felony.
